channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-8797] Prevent merging regions from moving during online merge
item.description: When two regions are merged online, they are closed but master doesn't know they should stay closed during the merge. If master moves them by mistake, for example, load balancer kicks in, the merge could be messed up.
item.summary: Prevent merging regions from moving during online merge

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: If a region has been closed on the RegionServer when merging, it won't be moved.
Maybe I didn't understand the case, could you describe the process of case? Thanks

Normally, it should not move. But if load balancer thinks this region server has too many regions, it could move some regions to other server, right?
Although the chance is low, the consequence is very bad. Therefore, we should be sure it won't happen.

Do you mean moving other regions, not merging regions, right?
Thus, after completing region merge, Load Balancer will move regions again since merge transaction decrease the region count, right?
I meant the region load could be imbalanced even before the merge. Users/applications could move the region by mistake too.
I got it,
In the attached patch, a new state MERGING is adding. When two regions are merging to a new one, both existing regions are moved to MERGING state so that they won't be moved by mistake.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12590337/trunk-8797.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 6 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop1.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.0 profile.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

-1 lineLengths. The patch introduces lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

This message is automatically generated.

Nothing to do when you get this Jimmy?


+          LOG.info("Processed region " + regionInfo.getEncodedName()

+              + " in state : " + et + " nothing to do.");

+        }

Just pass through?

Should this RS_ZK_REGION_MERGE be called RS_ZK_REGION_MERGED ?

In isInStateForMerging, you are testing isOpenOrMergingOnServer. That seems a little loose? Should it just be testing isMergingOnServer only?

So, if RS crashes after putting up two MERGING znodes, they are ephemeral (are they?) and they will just evaporate? When the logs for crashed server are played, we will just presume the merge did not succeed? And will assign out the two regions that were merging? Is there a hole in here where the merge succeeded but master was not notified yet? In this case will we find the merged region and assign it out?

If we get the merge message and then that the RS has crashed, ofter WAL split, we'll assign out the merged region .. and not the two daughter inputs?

Patch looks good Jimmy.

Just pass through?

Stack, good catch. I was thinking about it too last night. We should update the state to merging here.

Should this RS_ZK_REGION_MERGE be called RS_ZK_REGION_MERGED ?

Yes, I agree. But that's some existing code. I will fix it anyway since I need to post another patch.

In isInStateForMerging, you are testing isOpenOrMergingOnServer. That seems a little loose? Should it just be testing isMergingOnServer only?

Depends. For the first time, we need to check if it's OpenOnServer. Later, we should check MergingOnServer only. Since a region can't be both open and merging on the same server, such a checking is enough.

So, if RS crashes after putting up two MERGING znodes, they are ephemeral (are they?) and they will just evaporate? When the logs for crashed server are played, we will just presume the merge did not succeed? And will assign out the two regions that were merging? Is there a hole in here where the merge succeeded but master was not notified yet? In this case will we find the merged region and assign it out?

Yes, the merging znode is ephemeral. If the RS crashes, the znode should be gone. There could be a hole here. We need to figure out whether we should assign out the two merging regions, or the new merged region.

If we get the merge message and then that the RS has crashed, ofter WAL split, we'll assign out the merged region .. and not the two daughter inputs?

If we get the merge message, the two merging regions are already removed from meta and the new region is already inserted into meta. The two daughter inputs won't be assigned out any more.

Attached patch v2. It set the region to MERGING state properly during master failover. It also removed RegionState#isSplit since we never set a region state to SPLIT currently. Added region state MERGED. Renamed RS_ZK_REGION_MERGE to RS_ZK_REGION_MERGED.

As to Stack's questions, if RS crashes, merging regions are indeed assigned by SSH if meta is not updated yet; otherwise, the new region is assigned and the two merging regions are skipped.
V2.1 makes sure succeeded merging won't be stuck in transition, i.e., it's offlined in AM#processServerShutdown.

+1 on commit especially as you have the hbase-it merging test coming in in another issue.

Why this:


-                  || rit.isClosed() || rit.isOpened() || rit.isSplit()) {

+                  || rit.isClosed() || rit.isOpened()) {

i.e. removing the isSplit?

.. and this:


if (rit.isSplitting() || rit.isSplit()) {

Why we no longer have to cater to the described state?

We have not test of new online merge? It is postponed to hbase-it? Thats fine if that is the case.

Currently, we never set a region to split state any more. That's why it's removed. So far, I just made sure the unit tests are ok. For testing on live cluster, I will do it with the hbase-it issue. Thanks a lot for the review.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12590548/trunk-8797_v2.1.patch
against trunk revision .
